Subjects: Christ, Passion of, Passion, meditations on
_description: Meditations and prayers on the Passion — a verse rendering of the prose Hundred Meditations in Oxford, Bodleian Library Bodley 88 (SC 1873) (printed), ff. 79v-86, as a supplement to Suso’s Horologium Sapientiae

BodeMus160.First Lines:
HAylle benigne lorde crist iesuffull of grace & mercyes
                    newe…
BodeMus160.Last Lines:
…& thair meke compassiounBee thowe delitit now &
                    aye
BodeMus160.Note: Preceded by prose prologues on ff. 116-17.
BodeMus160.Attributed Title:
Thus endes þe prologe of hym þat in to latyn translate the said C
                    meditacions The prologe of hym þat translat þes said C meditacions
                    into ynglish meter folowes her after (f. 116); Thus endes his prologe & his
                    prayere buke here begynes (f. 117); Her endes the prayer buke of the C
                    meditations (f. 135v)
